div.sent: We use every day many of the things surrounding us.
We work in the fields.
We build homes and houses.
We catch fish in the river.
We use the water of the river in various activities.
We get wood from the forest.
We walk along the streets.
We go to school.
We travel by various types of vehicles.
The things which fulfil our personal and social needs are called resources.
State Resources: The resources under the ownership of the state are called state resources.
The government directly governs the state resources.
All citizens of the country have the right to enjoy these resources.
Social Resources: Human beings develop many resources for their own necessity.
These are schools, hospitals, mosques, temples, churches, libraries, clubs, parks, playgrounds, roads, culverts, etc.
House-holds, properties, cows, buffalos, goats, ducks and poultry, etc. are personal resources.
We can easily go from one place to another.
We can sell the local products at higher prices by carrying them to other places.
Generally on mud roads bullock carts, buffalo carts, vans, push carts can be used.
These are very useful for local people.
Many bridges, culverts, etc. have been built up in this riverine country.
Bridges on big rivers, on canals, culverts on small canals have been built up.
There are bamboo pathways (SHANKO) to go across canals in many villages.
These are used to go to schools, markets or to distant places.
Various types of vehicles pass along the bridges.
Ferries take time.
It is risky to use ferries in times of rain or storms.
Small children find it difficult to use bamboo pathways.
With bridges across the rivers, we can cross them easily and quickly.
Water is another name for life.
Man cannot live without water.
We need water for drinking, cooking, bathing, washing plates and clothes, farming, etc.
It is used in the mills and factories.
It is used to put out fire.
We get water from rivers, canals, marchy lands, large tanks, lakes, ponds and tube-wells.
It rains a lot in our country.
Ponds are filled up with rain water.
Rainwater is very important for cultivation.
We get fish from ponds.
We cultivate fish in ponds, big tanks and other water bodies.
There are tube-wells in most villages of our country.
A tube- well is also called a hand driven machine.
Most of the people of our country drink tube-well water.
We use this water for cooking.
We also use tube-well water for other purposes.
There are ponds at many homes of the village.
We bathe in the pond, wash plates and dishes and clothes.
We cultivate fish in the pond.
We drink the water of the pond.
However, the water of the pond should be drunk after boiling it properly.
Electricity is one kind of power.
We cannot do without electricity.
It lights our homes and roads and streets.
Fans run on electricity.
The telecommunication system becomes inactive without electricity.
Television and radio are run on electricity.
A computer cannot work without electricity.
We need electricity to run mills and factories.
It is also needed for irrigating lands.
It is used to run modern equipment for detecting diseases.
It is needed to run tractors for cultivation.
We need electricity to preserve crops.
Natural gas is the most important mineral resource of Bangladesh.
It is used to produce energy, light and electricity and other kinds of power.
It is the main power of the industries of the country.
Gas is the raw material of fertilizer factories.
It is used to produce insecticides.
We use gas for cooking.
Gas is being used to run motorcars and baby-taxis.
The use of gas in our country is multi-dimensional.
Natural gas is our State resource.
The telephone is very important in modem living.
Many of our close relatives and friends live in different places of the country.
Many of them also live in foreign countries.
We talk to them over the telephone.
At present the mobile phone has brought about a revolution in communication.
Due to lack of proper drainage system, the environment is affected.
Introduction to Environment: Social Studies 145 Human beings are attacked with various diseases.
Generally the drainage system in our country is limited to the towns.
This system has been built in developed villages.
It is necessary to build up drainage system in all the villages.
There are post offices in the towns and villages of Bangladesh.
A post office has a postmaster and a peon.
We buy postcards and envelopes from the post offices to write letters to the relatives.
The postman delivers them to our homes.
We feel happy when he comes.
In some post offices there is arrangement for sending telegrams and making telephone calls.
There are clubs in big cities.
There are also clubs at thana/ upazila level.
Clubs have been formed in many villages too.
Many development activities are done through clubs.
We participate in entertainment activities in the clubs.
It is necessary to form clubs in those villages where there is no club.
There are libraries like clubs in towns and villages.
We will build up libraries in those villages where there is no library.
Games and sports are necessary for good health.
And 146 Our Social and State Resources playground is needed for this.
We will play various kinds of games in the playground.
Parks are built in towns.
People go to the parks to bring variety in a dull life.
Places of worship are built to observe religion.
We go to mosques, temples, churches and pagodas to perform religious activities.
We come to know about the important things of our own religions in these places.
Water, electricity and gas are State resources.
AH the people of the state have right to these resources.
We will never waste them.
We will use them according to our needs.
We will not use the lights and fans unnecessarily at home and school.
We will use as much water as we need.
We will switch off the fans and lights during the lunch period and after school.
We will not keep the gas cooker on in the kitchen.
We will make sure that the gas cooker is off.
Our resources are limited.
The country is overpopulated.
We will be losers if the resources are reduced quickly.
We will be economical in using water, electricity and gas.
We will take care of the books of the library.
We will read the library books and will not damage any book.
We will not make the park dirty by throwing away nuts, grams and chanachur.
We will not throw plastic bottles here and there.
We will not make the benches of the park dirty.
These are our social resources.
We ourselves use these things.
So it is our social duty and responsibility to take care of these things.
